TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IChannel implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ICloseable, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: A channel is a conduit to I/O services covering such items as files, sockets, hardware devices, I/O ports or some software component.

remarks.para: A channel is a conduit to I/O services covering such items as files, sockets, hardware devices, I/O ports or some software component.

Channels are open upon creation, and can be closed explicitly. Once a channel is closed it cannot be re-opened, and any attempts to perform I/O operations on the closed channel result in a ClosedChannelException.
Particular implementations or sub-interfaces of Channel dictate whether they are thread-safe or not.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed

remarks.para: Closes an open channel. If the channel is already closed then this method has no effect. If there is a problem with closing the channel then the method throws an IOException and the exception contains reasons for the failure.
If an attempt is made to perform an operation on a closed channel then a will be thrown on that attempt.
If multiple threads attempt to simultaneously close a channel, then only one thread will run the closure code, and others will be blocked until the first returns.

Docs.exception: if a problem occurs closing the channel.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: Android.Runtime.Register("isOpen", "()Z", "GetIsOpenHandler:Java.Nio.Channels.IChannelInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")

Docs.summary: Returns true if this channel is open.

remarks.para: Returns true if this channel is open.
